newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria's ATX at new high, VA Stahl leads the way.
newsitem.headline: Austria's ATX at new high, VA Stahl leads the way.

text.p: Austria's ATX index on Thursday rallied to its highest close since the index was recalculated in January 1991, thanks to demand for a handful of market heavyweights -- particularly OMV and VA Stahl.
Traders forecast the market would remain buoyant although the expiry of July futures and options contracts on Friday could temporarily weigh on prices.
"Many tried today to roll over their positions into August. That'll continue tomorrow," said one trader, confident of a smooth expiry.
"If it's not all rolled over, then there could be a bit of selling pressure at expiry," cautioned another.
The ATX index added on 22.95 points, or 1.63 percent, to 1,429.29 -- just off the day's high at 1,431.28. Of its constituents, 18 advanced, one fell and two were unchanged.
OMV was the most actively traded issue, gaining 2.81 percent to 1,683 schillings on turnover of 112,830 lots.
Steelmaker VA Stahl led ATX gainers, up 3.76 percent or 23 schillings to record a new high at 635. Cartonboard maker Mayr-Melnhof also recorded a new high, up 3.24 percent at 670.
Insurer Wiener Staedtische was the sole ATX decliner, albeit losing just 0.05 schillings to 1,094.95.
The broad-based Vienna bourse index added on 6.07 points or 1.2 percent to 511.92
The July ATX future jumped 16.4 points to 1,432 on turnover of 2,463 contracts.
